intro: Mosiera flavicans, commonly known as the yellow-flowered mosiera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow flowers and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or wetlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
